name: Lemongrass Shrimp and Rice
author: CRNAsarah
summary: A very tasty copycat bowl from a popular Caribbean chain restaurant that includes shrimp, rice, snow peas, and edamame, flavored with lemongrass, lime, and coconut milk.
ingredients: 3  4- to 6-inch lemon grass stalks, ends removed and coarsely chopped
1 ½ pounds uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
directions: Combine coconut milk, lime juice, lime zest, lemon grass, garlic, and shallot in a blender
Refrigerate 1 1/4 cups of the puree for later use
Pour the rest into a large bowl; add shrimp
Cover and refrigerate until shrimp is marinated, 2 to 3 hours
Bring brown rice and water to a boil in a saucepan while shrimp marinate
Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until rice is tender and liquid has been absorbed, 45 to 50 minutes
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat
Add edamame and snow peas; saute until tender but still crispy, 3 to 5 minutes
Add the 1 1/4 cups of reserved puree and bring to a simmer
Add shrimp and marinade to the sauce in the skillet; cook until shrimp are firm and no longer pink, 8 to 10 minutes
